results.title: Outward bound girls' scheme
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Horizons”.
The aims and activities of the ‘Outward Bound’ girls’ residential course at Rhewniar in the rugged country of mid-west Wales. Shows the arrival of a new course and the girls being introduced to the accommodation and facilities. Includes fitness training, tuition in camp craft, canoe construction, rope work, home nursing, drama and self expression. The girls are seen accepting the ever increasing challenge of mountains, rivers and open waters in progressive expeditions. Photographed by Alan Masters, edited by Stella Smallwood, music by Denis Moonan, commentary by Richard Baker.

results.title: Outward bound
results.brief_description: This film follows a group of six young men on the 99th Outward Bound Course. The dialogue conveys their thoughts and feelings as they take part in rock-climbing, canoeing, caving, cross-country running, and camping. Shows the different reactions of the group to the challenge of survival in these conditions. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Outward bound
results.brief_description: Describes courses at the two “Outward Bound” schools where boys from all walks of life are provided with character training. At Aberdovey on the coast of Wales, four weeks training is given to young boys bound for the Merchant Navy. At the school in Eskdale, Cumberland, special attention is given to the skills necessary in mountain climbing and life-saving.

results.title: Outnumbered
results.creator_credit: Richard Keddie, Andrew Wiseman, Apollo Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary provides a candid look behind the 1996 election campaign of the Victorian Opposition Labor Party, headed by John Brumby. He has a number of factors working against him in a seemingly unwinnable campaign; a drastically low budget, poor public perception, and healthy support for the Coalition. This documentary focuses on John Brumby as an individual who is honest and frank in his opinions, as well as illustrating how the media is capable of shaping public opinion and in turn dictating the creation of the images of modern politics.

results.title: Outdoor cooking in winter
results.creator_credit: Norman Keziere, James McCormick and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: The preparation of a “kitchen area” in a winter wilderness camp is described in detail. Subsistence diets are not an automatic part of roughing it outdoors and here ways are shown of using nature’s natural resources to aid in personal comfort. The preparation of fish and birds for the open fire is shown and the proper method of cooking over an open fire - slowly and turning the meat regularly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Keziere, James McCormick and Moreland-Latchford Productions

results.title: Outback patrol
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An insight into the life of Constable Robert Darken of the Northern Territory Police Force. Every mid-summer, Constable Darken leaves home for a two to three month turn-around of his beat, several thousand square miles of rugged and barren country of the Territory. Here, he inspects cattle, water towers, mines, registers births and marriages, even acts as postmaster, duties which are a far cry from the usual conception of police duties.

results.title: Out shopping
results.creator_credit: Eric Marquis, Ronald H. Riley and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: Two housewives go out on a morning’s shopping. Newly married Mrs A does it unthinkingly; mature Mrs B with dkill. The two meet and Mrs A learns some useful tips. Consumer instructional film successfully using a comedy approach avoiding offence to put across the positive message that shopping must be done carefully.

results.title: Out of this world
results.brief_description: Introduced by Hywell Davies, this documentary covers a visit to a Carmelite convent in England showing the daily life of this contemplative order of nuns.

results.title: Out of the mouths (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bernice Rubens, Document Productions and Oral Hygiene Service
results.brief_description: An unscripted film shot mainly in a Dorset primary school where an older pupil project on dental health is in progress. It includes discussion during a meeting of the parent/teacher association.

results.title: Out of the forest
results.creator_credit: Stephen Clarkson, A. Frank Bundy, United Steel Companies and Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: Shows some of the remarkable range of chemical products which have their origin in coal. Explains the production of coke for the blast furnaces used by steel companies.
